meanings.definition: To cause (someone) to feel ashamed or foolish by injuring their dignity and self-respect.
meanings.sent1: She humiliated him by laughing at his mistake in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: He felt humiliated when his boss scolded him in front of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The cat humiliated the dog by stealing its favorite toy and parading it around.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in the final match humiliated the team, leaving them feeling defeated and embarrassed.
meanings.sent5: The public rejection humiliated her, making her want to hide away from everyone.

meanings.definition: To be made to feel ashamed or foolish by injuring one's dignity and self-respect.
meanings.sent1: She humiliated herself by tripping on stage during the performance.
meanings.sent2: He was humiliated when his secret was exposed in front of his friends.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter humiliated himself by spilling drinks on the guests.
meanings.sent4: The student humiliated himself by giving the wrong answer confidently in class.
meanings.sent5: The politician humiliated himself with a poorly thought-out speech, causing laughter among the audience.
